Html:
So, I'm working through the example here:

http://www.codeproject.com/KB/recipes/YourFirstDSL.aspx

But, it references classes that appear to have been removed from Irony, unless I'm missing something. The code block:

 

CameraControlGrammar grammar = new CameraControlGrammar();
LanguageCompiler compiler = new LanguageCompiler(grammar);
AstNode program = compiler.Parse("the source code as a string");

uses the LanguageCompiler class, which I can't find. Help?

None of the examples I've found seem to provide much insight into walking the AST tree. 
The grammar definition examples are great, but I'm unclear on how to get an AST back that I can then walk to compile my app.

The code in this article is completely outdated.
Look at SearchGrammar class and RunSample method - it walks the parse tree

I had this same problem, and figured out what to do by going through the grammar explorer.
http://irony.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=216123
